intro: Klopstockia quindiuensis, commonly known as the Quindío klopstockia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive bracts and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in cloud forests at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
